page.title: 18WOLSTON CLUBS/ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: For the children there are Brownies, Cubs,{Guides and Scouts who meet weekly. For the teenagers there is a {Youth Club}where they can learn life skills combined with sporting and leisure activities through a government sponsored scheme for helping unemployed youth. 1985, being {International Youth Year,}saw many youth groups in Wolston united in a special commemorative service. Adults take part in their own groups such as Women's Institute, Wives Fellowship, Mothers' Union, Keep-fit, football, cricket, hockey, golf and angling clubs, skittles, dominoes and various other activities held in local pubs. {Senior citizens}attend The Evergreens Club and play whist, have raffles and enjoy outings and companionship. Both schools hold annual concerts for residents as well as social events.
